ratings.comment: Great professor, cool and pretty awesome actually. I think he knows a lot more though as every political scientist does. Go into office hours and pick his brain and see what he know and help him get smarter, he is very smart and very helpful. He's awesome! Take his class!
He is pretty arrogant. I don't think his lectures were very effective, I learned more from the textbook.
Ken was a great proffesor. On Halloween his kids came to class, they were so cute. He's a very knowledgable proffesor who knows his stuff. I enjoyed his class alot!

Interesting lectures, but he rarely follows the powerpoints. Its important to have a good TA who re-explains the things from lecture that might be on the test, because he definitely doesn't give many hints. However, his review questions tend to be on exams. He is really hard to get in contact with, since he takes a while to get back to you.

Goldstein's a great prof, I only went to class about 25% of the time because I worked, but wish I could've gone more. I read the text and was fine, it's the studying for exams that really matters in this class. Definitely recommend him & will be taking a class with him again.
Easy to follow, super intersting lecture, discussion attendence may be manditory, tests are pretty easy if you pay attention, do a little studying, provides study sheets with topics for tests

I love this guy. Best professor I've had at UW. An interesting and funny lecturer: tells great anecdotes, brings his kids to class, tells jokes, answers people's phones, etc. I actually look forward to lecture. Class isn't hard at all. Read and go to lecture and you'll be fine. He clearly cares and is very knowledgeable about the material. A+

This was the single best course I took at UW. He is a charismatic and gifted professor - with a total command of the material. The secret to doing well in this course is reading all of the material carefully before class, going to class, taking notes in class, and studying before the exam. The exams test the material he teaches. Do that: Get an A
Good class, interesting teacher...but is full of himself and VERY unapproachable when it comes to help on a topic.

Ken was a little inattentive to PoliSci 467 because it was election year. Class got cancelled a lot of times and we didn't use the expensive textbook for more than a lecture. That said, Ken is extremely knowledgeable about what he teaches and is pretty clear about what you should expect on tests. The final project was a lot of work but graded easy.
Ken's a good teacher.  He's very fair and straightforward.  The class is not difficult as it seems that most of his students get a B or AB... it's just really hard to get that A.
He's wonderful!  He is very knowledgeable.  He truly wants you to do well in the class by giving you study guides for the exams, extra study sessions, and extra credit points whenever possible.

Smart guy that knows a lot about politics. He puts all the lectures online for you to print off and follow. The class is pretty tough but he is really clear about what is on the tests and wants you to do well. Make sure you phone is on silent if you don't want him to answer it. I got a B in the class without doing the readings but they are helpful.

Goldstein was an interesting professor. If you like Politics, you'll enjoy the class for sure as i did. He gives u practically the whole test in review sheet form, and his review sessions were extremely helpful. Its easy to prepare for his exams, and they're pretty straight-forward

Ken is smart, funny and comprehensible but a bit full of himself.  Most test questions taken right from lecture.  Readings are dull but he takes few tests questions from them.  Short answers are easy but mult choice are very tricky.  TAs can help a lot.  Wide grade distribution. (i got AB)  Don't fall asleep or let your phone ring in class.

Great professor! Humorous and engaging during lecture, keeps you awake for power lectures.  Tests are hard, but reading textbook and the readings isn't absolutely necessary.  Top scoring section on each test gets invited to his PERSONAL home for a home-cooked meal. No final exam. Great class, GREAT PROFESSOR! Will definitely take him again if I can

I definitely recommend this class. Readings are long and time consuming, but not necessary to do well. Lecture notes can be printed off before class. Prof. Goldstein is a little into himself, but who can blame him? He's a great professor, very energetic, funny, and keeps his students interested.

very smart man who knows his stuff,makes material pretty interesting in lectures (must go to clasS!!!)found my TA matt to be very helpful.HOWEVER,his tests are VERY Hard. I went to every lecture, every disc., read all the readings, saw my TA/Prof., studied for 25+ hours and got C's on the tests! good lecture, not-so-easy grade.

I really like that he puts the power points online before the lectures so it's easier to add other notes.  He really goes over the material well and indepth. Oh, and he tends to make fun of people and DON'T let your phone ring in class...he'll answer it and talk to the person

Very informative teacher, taught me a lot so far, tests are VERY hard and even if you study as much as 12 hours, you are likely to at best get a high B. He knows his stuff, but also knows that he knows his stuff. He is a witty person and very clever. Kept the power lecture interesting.  Most interesting class and hardest at same time for me.

Ignore the bad stuff you read about Goldstein.  He is funny and engaging in lecture.  His tests are harder, however he gives you a full study guide with all of the multiple choice concepts you need to know and he also gives 10 short answer questions to study for, 3 of which are guaranteed to be on the test.  Great professor, I recommend him.

I took this class last year in my first semester. He's an entertaining professor and generally a good guy. The class was good, fairly easy, and the tests were all multiple choice, so they weren't bad at all.
I had this guy last year. He is a cool dude, but sucks as a teacher. His exams are hard, no matter how much you study for them. Joel was a good TA. Try to avoid this class if you can.

Was an interesting course and though lectures got a bit dry at moments, Professor Goldstein made attempts to make lectures more fun and interesting. Tests aren't that hard as long as you read the materials, went to lecture and studied a bit!
Knows his stuff but arrogant as hell. His TA, David Rodriguez, was awesome!

Goldstein is an arrogant son of a ****.  He thinks he is the smartest man on the face of the earth...but hes not.  Professor Schultz is.  His exams are extremely hard and some readings can be fifty pages long.  Don't take this class if he is teaching it, take it with somebody else.
Good class...interesting material...but Goldstein's tests are really difficult...no matter how much you study, it seems like an A is impossible.

Goldstein can be very unpleasant if you get on his bad side, but as long as you don't do anything in class to annoy him (cell phones off!), that shouldn't be a problem.  Lectures are often dull with sparks of excitement, be sure to go to them, he takes a lot of questions from stuff he says in class that is NOT on the lecture slides!

The lectures were really interesting, and for a power lecture I thought he kept the class's attention really well. However, the exams were impossible even thought I started studying days (sometimes even a week) in advance. Don't take this class unless political science is one of your strengths, because if it's not you will probably get frustrated.
He is a decent teacher, but simply put, just not a good person...hes the least helpful teacher ive had in my life. dont take this class i would say
Good prof, interesting class...made me more interested in poli sci, but it is hard to get a good grade...tests are difficult
Don't take this class if you're not into poli sci.  If you like it, he is a really good professor.  it is way to hard to get A's though.

This was the worst class ever.  I had to force myself through the readings because they were the longest and most boring things I've ever had to read in my entire life.  It's pretty much impossible to get As on the tests.  I was lucky to get Bs.  He isn't very clear on things either.  I hated my TA too.
this class BLOWS! seriously, most boring class ever. this **** makes the hardest tests ever. do not take this class. his jokes are lame and he so is he.
i think he is a great professor on teaching the corse, but his exams are way too hard and no curve. i do not recommend people who is not that interest in politics to take his class.
he's funny but the readings suck

Pretty good professor.  Lectures are important to go to even though he puts the slides on the internet.  He adds a lot of info on top of the outline.  Exams are sort of difficult, you have to do all of the readings which are super boring.  Overall an "okay" class.
good teacher keeps things interesting
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Goldstein tries to be cool....okay he is cool. Class was interesting, I never missed lecture. Great stories from his experience with ABC News as well. Doesn't return e-mails very well, however. Otherwise, he's great!
A very interesting lecturer, he is hard, but it is a very good class, he brings real world experience and sense of humor to the classroom

The class was tough, and the exams kicked your ass, but let me say this, when he dressed up as an 'undergrad' for Halloween, he was one of the cutest ones there!  All I did was watch him pull up his pants the whole time.  His sex appeal worked in his favor.
Great professor!  loved the class
Didn't really seem like an intro course.  Although entertaining, doesn't really seem to care to teach.

He knows his stuff but is better off working for ABC or NBC, not teaching. Can be funny. Makes the TAs work too much and do all the grading, doesn't really  care about individual students. Won't bother to remember you even if you've talked to him several times.
kind of hot
Goldstein is a very amusing lecturer. His tests are hard for it being an intro class.  Know the material.  He's kinda sexy, too.
Hard tests, but he is funny and entertaining. Do not bring your cell phone, if it rings, he will answer it. Glad he is staying at WI though, and not going back to Michigan!
Whatever- his tests are hard

Pretty funny professor. Tough tests, rigid, and often picks at people, but is a fun and semi-interesting class. As long as you're not the target of his jokes, it's all good. Also, turn your phone off--he'll find any ringing cell and answers for you.
No Comments
He's funny and entertaining.
No Comments
Ken is a funny guy and pretty cute!
